name: Dohko
tagline: An autonomic and goal-oriented cloud architecture
body:
Dohko is a goal-oriented cloud architecture that aims to simplify the cloud for the users through a declarative strategy. 
It implements the autonomic properties: self-configuration, self-healing, and context-awareness. In Dohko, the users specify the applications and the requirements (e.g., number of CPU cores, maximal financial cost per hour, among others), and the system automatically (a) selects the resources (i.e., VMs) that meet the constraints; (b) configures and installs the applications in the clouds; (c) handles resource failures; and (d) executes the applications.
